newsitem.title: USA: Moody's affirms Household International debt.
newsitem.headline: Moody's affirms Household International debt.

text.p: Moody's Investors Service said on Wednesday it affirmed Household International Inc's A3 senior unsecured debt, Baa1 preferred stock, Prime-2 commercial paper, and A3 counterparty ratings.
Moody's also said it is maintaining the company's negative outlook.
About $24 billion of debt securities are affected.
The affirmation follows the company's annoucement of its agreement to purchase Transamerica Corp's consumer finance business for $1.1 billion.
The acquisition includes about $3 billion of real estate-secured receivables and $300 million of unsecured receivables, and it will expand Household's branch network.
The purchase excludes receivables that are delinquent by more than 60 days and non-performing assets.

Moody's noted that the acquisition is consistent with management's strategy of focusing on core businesses and on improving operating efficiency, in this instance through greater scale in the branch-based distribution channel and through the leveraging of centralized support functions.
Household's commitment to issue $900 million of common stock over the next several months will bring tangible leverage back to pre-acquisition levels, Moody's added.
However, Moody's continues to have concern that the pace of acquisitions and internal growth will, over time, pressure Household's operational and financial resources.
